name: Corn and Roasted Poblano Pasta
description: This corn and roasted poblano pasta combines classic Mexican flavors for a spicy, creamy, and delicious weeknight dinner.

video.name: Creamy Poblano and Corn Pasta
video.description: Creamy corn and roasted poblano pasta, made with vegan alfredo sauce.

recipeIngredient: 1 jar Primal Kitchen Garlic Alfredo Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Place your poblano peppers right on the burner of the gas stove and let the flame char the pepper on all sides. Place the peppers in a container and cover with a lid or plastic wrap. Let sit for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Place your poblano peppers right on the burner of the gas stove and let the flame char the pepper on all sides. Place the peppers in a container and cover with a lid or plastic wrap. Let sit for 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: With a paring knife, scrape the skin off the pepper. Make a cut lengthwise and remove the seeds. Cut off stem and cut into strips. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: With a paring knife, scrape the skin off the pepper. Make a cut lengthwise and remove the seeds. Cut off stem and cut into strips. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Add spaghetti and cook until al dente.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Add spaghetti and cook until al dente.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large sauté pan to medium heat, add oil, and onions. Let cook for 3 - 4 minutes until tender and translucent. Add garlic and cook for 1 more minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a large sauté pan to medium heat, add oil, and onions. Let cook for 3 - 4 minutes until tender and translucent. Add garlic and cook for 1 more minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add corn and vegetable broth and turn heat down to low. Simmer for 2 minutes. Add poblano peppers and stir to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Add corn and vegetable broth and turn heat down to low. Simmer for 2 minutes. Add poblano peppers and stir to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour in garlic alfredo sauce and let simmer slowly for 5-6 minutes. Add spaghetti and stir to combine. Sprinkle with chopped cilantro, serve immediately.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour in garlic alfredo sauce and let simmer slowly for 5-6 minutes. Add spaghetti and stir to combine. Sprinkle with chopped cilantro, serve immediately.

keywords: corn, poblano peppers, rajas con crema
